title: Agronomic Inputs
description: Requirements for agronomic inputs including fertilizers and amendments (both animal-based and non-animal based), risk assessments, regulatory compliance, application records, certificates of analysis, and thermal treatment of growing media

requirements.text: What type(s) of fertilizers and amendments are used in the growing operation? Information gathering question
mandatoryStatements: This is an information gathering question
Response identifies types of fertilizers and amendments used
Information used to determine applicable subsequent questions
requirements.verificationExpectations: Documentation of fertilizer and amendment types used in operation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update information when input types change

requirements.text: Are animal based or derived amendments used in the growing operation? Information gathering question
mandatoryStatements: This is an information gathering question
Response identifies if animal-based or derived amendments are used
If yes, questions 3.10.02 and 3.10.02a apply
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update information when amendment types change

requirements.text: Are non-animal based or derived amendments used in the growing operation? Information gathering question
mandatoryStatements: This is an information gathering question
Response identifies if non-animal based amendments are used
If yes, questions 3.10.03 and 3.10.03a apply
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update information when amendment types change

requirements.text: Are synthetic fertilizers used as an input (e.g., ammonium nitrate, ammonium sulfate, chemically synthesized urea, etc.)? Information gathering question
mandatoryStatements: This is an information gathering question
Response identifies if synthetic fertilizers are used
Examples include ammonium nitrate, ammonium sulfate, synthesized urea
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update information when fertilizer types change

requirements.text: Is there a documented risk assessment in place for all animal-based or derived fertilizers and amendments used in the growing operation?
mandatoryStatements: If animal-based or derived amendments used, risk assessment is documented
Assessment addresses pathogen contamination risks
Assessment evaluates heavy metal risks
Assessment considers application methods and timing
Assessment identifies hazards specific to each amendment type
Assessment includes biological, chemical, and physical hazards
Risk assessment is reviewed and updated at least annually
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of animal-based amendment risk assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Review risk assessment when new animal-based amendments introduced

requirements.text: Where the risk assessment identifies the need for control of any hazards, are these controls indicated in the assessment and implemented?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment identifies specific controls for each hazard
Controls are clearly documented in the assessment
All identified controls are implemented in operations
Controls may include treatment, application timing, application methods
Controls are effective at reducing or eliminating hazards
Implementation of controls is verified through monitoring
Records demonstrate ongoing implementation of controls
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that all amendment controls are implemented and effective
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily or per-application monitoring of control implementation

requirements.text: Is there a documented risk assessment in place for all fertilizers and amendments not containing animal-based or derived components used in the growing operation?
mandatoryStatements: If non-animal based fertilizers/amendments used, risk assessment is documented
Assessment addresses heavy metal contamination risks
Assessment evaluates chemical hazards
Assessment considers application methods and rates
Assessment identifies hazards specific to each input type
Assessment includes biological, chemical, and physical hazards
Risk assessment is reviewed and updated at least annually
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of non-animal based input risk assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Review risk assessment when new inputs introduced

requirements.text: Where the risk assessment identifies the need for control of any hazards, are these controls indicated in the assessment and implemented?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment identifies specific controls for each hazard
Controls are clearly documented in the assessment
All identified controls are implemented in operations
Controls are appropriate for the specific input and hazard
Controls are effective at reducing or eliminating hazards
Implementation of controls is verified through monitoring
Records demonstrate ongoing implementation of controls
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that all input controls are implemented and effective
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily or per-application monitoring of control implementation

requirements.text: Are the fertilizers and/or amendments being used according to local and national regulations or guidelines?
mandatoryStatements: All fertilizers and amendments used are approved for use
Use complies with local regulations and guidelines
Use complies with national/federal regulations
Application rates comply with regulatory limits
Application timing follows regulatory requirements
Required documentation and registrations are maintained
Operation stays current with regulatory changes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of regulatory compliance for all inputs
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of regulatory compliance, immediate action if regulations change

requirements.text: Are there fertilizer and/or amendment use records available for each growing area, including application records?
mandatoryStatements: Fertilizer and amendment application records are maintained
Records identify specific growing areas where applied
Records show application dates
Records show application rates and methods
Records identify specific products applied
Records show who performed applications
Records support traceability and compliance verification
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of fertilizer/amendment application records for completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Documentation completed for each application event

requirements.text: Are there Certificate(s) of Analysis (CoA), specifications, product label or other documents available for review provided by the supplier stating the components of the material and that cover heavy metal testing?
mandatoryStatements: Certificates of Analysis (CoA) are obtained from suppliers
CoA or specifications state material components
Documentation covers heavy metal testing results
Heavy metals tested include cadmium, lead, arsenic, mercury at minimum
Test results show compliance with acceptable limits
Documentation is current and corresponds to materials in use
Alternative: product labels provide required information
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that CoA or specifications are on file for all inputs
requirements.monitoringExpectations: CoA obtained before first use of any new fertilizer or amendment

requirements.text: Are there Certificate(s) of Analysis (CoA) from the supplier(s) that cover pathogen testing (plus any other legally/best practice required testing) and does the grower have relevant letters of guarantee regarding supplier SOPs and logs?
mandatoryStatements: Certificates of Analysis covering pathogen testing are obtained
Pathogen testing appropriate for amendment type (especially animal-based)
Testing includes legally required pathogens (E. coli, Salmonella, etc.)
Supplier provides letters of guarantee regarding their processes
Supplier documentation includes SOPs and logs where applicable
Testing frequency is appropriate for risk level
Documentation demonstrates supplier quality controls
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of pathogen testing documentation for relevant inputs
requirements.monitoringExpectations: CoA and supplier guarantees obtained before use of high-risk amendments

requirements.text: Where practiced, are there records of growing media substrate (including soil) thermal treatment processes?
mandatoryStatements: If thermal treatment of growing media is practiced, records are maintained
Records document thermal treatment parameters (time and temperature)
Records show which batches or lots were treated
Treatment records demonstrate effective pathogen reduction
Temperature monitoring equipment is calibrated
Records link treated media to growing areas where used
Treatment process is validated for effectiveness
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of thermal treatment records where applicable
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Documentation completed for each thermal treatment batch

capaInject: If risk assessment for amendments not documented: develop assessment within 30 days, halt use of high-risk amendments until assessment complete
If amendment hazard controls not implemented: immediate implementation of critical controls, complete all controls within 14 days
If fertilizer/amendment use not compliant with regulations: immediate cessation of non-compliant use, regulatory consultation within 7 days
If application records not maintained: immediate implementation of record system, retroactive documentation where possible
If CoA or pathogen testing not available: obtain from supplier within 14 days, consider alternative suppliers if not provided
If thermal treatment records missing: implement documentation immediately, verify treatment effectiveness
traceabilityInject: Fertilizer and amendment application records must be traceable to specific growing areas and harvest batches
Certificates of Analysis must be traceable to specific lots of fertilizers/amendments received and used
Thermal treatment records must be traceable to specific media batches and growing areas where used
Supplier documentation must be traceable to specific products and suppliers
